snippet: Protesters in the capital, Bujumbura, assaulted people suspected of being members of the governing party’s youth group on Thursday as the upheaval over the president’s bid for a third term persisted.
abstract: Red Cross reports protestors in Burundi's capital Bujumbura attacked people suspected of belonging to governing party's youth group, killing three and wounding 13; revolts stemming from Pres Pierre Nkurunziza's bid for third term in looming elections have resulted in 13 deaths, 216 wounded and more than 30,000 Burundians fleeing to neighboring countries to avoid violence.
lead_paragraph: Protesters in the capital, Bujumbura, assaulted people suspected of being members of the governing party’s youth group on Thursday as the upheaval over the president’s bid for a third term persisted.

headline.print_headline: Africa; Burundi: Protesters Attack President’s Supporters
